issue_description: Student reported struggling in course 1001 and feeling stressed about academic performance; talked with teacher to set up regular meeting times after class.
Student expressed uncertainty about which classes to take next term and requested help with course selection.
Student wanted guidance on adjusting current schedule and choosing courses that better match interests.
Student felt unsure about fitting in socially and was stressed about future job prospects; discussed attending a job fair to explore opportunities.
Student described general discomfort at school and wanted a brief check-in about how things are going overall.
Student came in for a general check-in about school and life with no specific concern but wanted someone to talk to.
Student had a severe headache and was visibly uncomfortable; referred to health care professional for evaluation and symptom management.
Student reported feeling lonely and isolated at school, with some impact on overall wellbeing and mood.
Student felt anxious in social situations and reported stress about interacting with peers in class and at lunch.
Student described tension at home and uncertainty about family expectations, and also discussed having a coffee chat related to future job interests.
Student had recent behavioral incidents in class, reported conflicts with peers, and felt stressed about how others perceive them.
Student missed a quiz in course 3230 and felt anxious about grades; made up missed quiz and discussed balancing coursework more effectively.
Student reported family-related stress at home while also exploring job opportunities, including attending a job fair.
Student felt overwhelmed and anxious about both family responsibilities and schoolwork, reporting difficulty relaxing.
Student requested a general check-in about school and life, sharing mild concerns but no single major issue.
Student had a recent behavioral issue in class and wanted to talk about improving reactions and behavior.
Student reported conflict with friends and feeling left out in social situations.
Student wanted advice about college and future career paths, asking about steps to prepare and explore options.
Student had trouble sleeping and extreme tiredness, affecting mood and focus; referred to a health care professional to discuss stress management and sleep routines.
Student needed help choosing between several course options and wanted to understand workload differences.
Student expressed a general concern that did not fit a specific category but wanted emotional support and guidance.
Student was depressed and also reported turning in incomplete assignments; discussed academic stress and was referred to a health care professional for further support.
Student had recent behavioral issues, including talking out of turn and not following class rules; wanted strategies for self-control.
Student reported tension with friends, feeling excluded from group activities and worried about peer relationships.
Student described family stress at home, difficulty managing social relationships, and worry about the future; also mentioned attending a job fair to explore opportunities.
Student came in with a miscellaneous concern not fitting a single category and wanted reassurance and brief support.
Student was overwhelmed with anxiety about college and career decisions and also attended a coffee chat to explore options; referred to a health care professional to work on stress management.
Student struggled with performance in a specific class and revised the last exam after meeting with the teacher to improve understanding.
Student worried about grades and long-term plans, turned in a project for course 1020 and discussed how academics tie into college goals.
Student was feeling socially isolated and depressed, reporting difficulty connecting with peers; referred to a therapist who helped identify coping techniques.
Student brought up a general concern about school that did not fit another category and wanted to briefly talk it through.
Student reported family pressures at home and stress about finances, while also applying to jobs to help with future plans.
Student sought guidance on course selection and how choices might affect college and career options.
Student felt stressed and anxious about managing the new schedule and how it might impact workload and grades.
Student reported frequent stomach aches that were affecting wellbeing; referred to a doctor who recommended diet changes, and student discussed how symptoms affected behavior and school attendance.
Student wanted information about potential college majors and asked how to start exploring future careers.
Student felt anxious about next year’s class schedule and whether it would be too demanding.
Student felt stressed about group work dynamics in course 2220 and got a new partner for a group project, aiming to improve both academic performance and social comfort.
Student had a behavioral incident in class and wanted to discuss how to handle frustration more appropriately.
Student was dizzy and had difficulty concentrating during the school day; referred to a doctor who diagnosed a concussion and advised avoiding electronics and strenuous activity.
Student fought with another student after being bullied, reporting strong emotions and difficulty managing anger; referred to a therapist for anger management strategies.
Student brought up a minor concern about school that did not clearly match another category and wanted a quick check-in.
Student shared concerns about conflict at home and feeling caught in family disagreements.
Student reported family concerns and uncertainty about future plans, and also mentioned going to a job fair to explore possible career paths.
Student wanted guidance on how current course choices may affect college and career options, asking whether to adjust classes for the future.
Student asked for advice about preparing for college and what steps to take during high school to stay on track.
Student had a recent behavioral issue at school and wanted help understanding expectations and improving behavior.
Student had suicidal thoughts and reported severe academic and emotional stress; also hired a tutor to help with coursework, and was referred to an in-depth therapy plan for stress and anxiety.
Student wants to transfer because of bullying, reporting ongoing harassment and feeling unsafe; referred to a health care professional to discuss schooling options and emotional support.
Student asked about college and career options and wanted help understanding application timelines and requirements.
Student’s recent behavior raised concerns in class; discussed strategies for following rules and managing impulses.
Student reported stress from family responsibilities at home and how it affects school focus; wanted to talk through possible supports.
Student needed guidance in choosing between several classes and asked about how each would affect workload and interests.
Student is suddenly restless and unable to focus in class and at home; referred to a doctor and prescribed medication, with discussion of how symptoms relate to stress and personal wellbeing.
Student reported feeling left out by peers and stressed about social situations, including group activities and lunch.
Student was struggling in a course and worked with the teacher one-on-one after school to catch up on material and improve confidence.
Student wanted help deciding whether to stay in or drop a class and asked about how changes affect future course plans.
Student described stress from family responsibilities and behavior at home, while also applying to jobs to support future goals; wanted help balancing these pressures.
Student reported having no motivation, difficulty starting tasks, and low energy; referred to a health care professional and learned grounding techniques to help manage these feelings.
Student needed help improving writing in course 4540 and revised an essay after feedback, hoping to raise the grade.
Student felt anxious about upcoming assignments and tests, describing trouble relaxing even after school.
Student reported tension with peers and wanted help navigating friendships and communication.
Student brought up a general concern about school life and wanted reassurance and support, without a single clear issue.
Student discussed family-related stress and responsibilities at home that make it harder to focus on schoolwork.
Student sought help choosing between different elective options and wanted to make sure the schedule stays manageable.
Student had behavior concerns related to frustration and irritability and wanted strategies to stay calm in stressful moments at home and school.
Student asked about long-term career interests and how to begin exploring job and college options.
Student felt stressed and anxious about future college plans and wanted reassurance about being on track.
Student struggled with missing and incomplete assignments in course 2220, then finished incomplete work and attended a coffee chat to explore how academics connect to future opportunities.
Student was not getting along with classmates and had ongoing peer conflict; discussed strategies to repair relationships and later apologized after reflecting on behavior.
Student described a concern that did not fit another category and wanted to briefly talk through feelings about school.
Student felt anxious and overwhelmed, especially around tests and deadlines, and wanted coping strategies for stress.
Student needed help choosing classes for the next term and asked about balancing difficulty levels and interests.
Student reported family stress and financial concerns, and also went to a job fair to learn more about future opportunities.
Student experienced shortness of breath in gym and during physical activity, felt worried about health and social impact; referred to a doctor and now carries an inhaler in gym class.
Student wanted guidance about future college and career options and asked about building experience over the next few years.
Student had questions about which course combination would best fit interests and long-term goals.
Student reported falling behind on assignments and made a plan to start completing work on time to improve academic standing.
Student skipped classes and reported feeling stressed and anxious about the future and expectations; discussed how worries about college and responsibilities affect attendance.
Student described family stress and emotional strain, asked for help managing wellbeing, and also mentioned getting support from a friend for studying.
Student refuses to leave the counselor’s office during difficult moments, indicating strong emotional distress; discussed safety, coping skills, and follow-up support.
Student struggled with academics in a course and asked a friend for help studying, also reporting stress about keeping up.
Student was feeling nauseous during the school day and worried about wellbeing; referred to a doctor and went home after receiving medicine.
Student had behavioral concerns, including difficulty following instructions and staying on task, and wanted help with self-control strategies.
Student felt anxious and overwhelmed by school demands, describing racing thoughts and trouble calming down.
Student asked for guidance on future career interests and how to prepare for college applications.
Student needed help understanding how course choices fit graduation requirements and long-term plans.
Student reported difficulty deciding on classes and felt uncertain about academic direction, wanting structured planning support.
Student brought up family tensions and possible financial stress, expressing concern about how home life impacts school.
Student described a non-specific concern about feeling off at school and wanted to talk through general worries.
Student made up a missed exam for course 2010 and also discussed academic stress, social pressures, and questions about college, combining academic, social, and future-related concerns.
Student feels like they have no friends and is worried about fitting in at school; discussed social skills and ways to build connections.
Student had behavioral reactions connected to feeling excluded by peers and wanted strategies for responding more calmly.
Student has a large rash and was worried about appearance and comfort; referred to a doctor and given ointment to treat the rash.
Student shared ongoing concerns about family conflict and how it affects emotional wellbeing and focus in class.
Student reported feeling dizzy at school and worried about underlying health; referred for medical evaluation to ensure safety.
Student brought up a serious concern about feeling unsafe at home and being afraid to go home; discussed safety planning and need for further support.
Student needed help choosing between class options and wanted to better align schedule with interests and goals.
Student is afraid to go home due to family-related concerns and reported feeling unsafe; discussed as a serious wellbeing and family issue and referred for additional support.
Student struggled academically after missing an exam in course 1001 and felt stressed about grades; discussed making up work and staying on track.
Student reported conflicts with peers, feeling left out of friend groups and worried about social reputation.
Student described high stress and anxiety about school performance and wanted tools to manage worry and nervousness.
Student raised a general concern that did not clearly match another category and wanted emotional support and guidance.
Student discussed family stress and possible financial concerns, along with worries about the future and stability.
Student requested advice on course choices in the context of family expectations and academic goals.
Student asked about possible careers and college paths, wanting to better understand how current choices affect future options.
Student reported feeling emotionally drained and wanting to talk about personal wellbeing, including tiredness and low mood.
Student expressed concern about academic performance and asked for a plan to stay organized and communicate more with teachers.
Student wanted help understanding future college and career directions and how to begin preparing now.
